title: Facebook Employee Leaps To His Death From Company Headquarters Building
text: A Facebook employee apparently leaped to his death today at the company headquarters in Menlo Park, Calif. The man, who has not been identified, jumped from the fourth floor of a building on the Facebook campus, according to police. He was pronounced dead at the scene. “Menlo Park Police Officers and Menlo Park Fire Protection

title: Trump says he had a 'nice' meeting with Facebook CEO Zuckerberg
text: President Donald Trump said in a tweet that he had a "nice meeting" with Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg on Thursday and he included a picture of him shaking hands with Zuckerberg in the Oval Office.

title: Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg meets with Donald Trump
text: The social network said Zuckerberg had a "good, constructive" meeting with the president.

title: Facebook's Zuckerberg met with President Trump at the White House
text: Trump has criticized Facebook numerous times since becoming president, most recently posting on Twitter that the company's proposed digital currency, libra, will "have little standing or dependability."

title: Trump, Facebook CEO Zuckerberg had 'good, constructive' meeting: Facebook
text: U.S. President Donald Trump and Facebook  Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg had a "good, constructive" meeting at the White House on Thursday, the social media company said in a statement.

title: Bezos and Zuckerberg Take Their Pitches to Washington
text: The Amazon and Facebook leaders were there for different reasons, but the appearances highlighted their companies’ need to reshape the public debate about their practices.

title: Facebook employee dies after apparent suicide at company’s Menlo Park headquarters
text: An employee of Facebook died Thursday morning following an apparent suicide, Menlo Park police reported and the company confirmed. “We were saddened to learn that one of our employees passed away at our Menlo Park headquarters earlier today,” a Facebook spokesperson told TechCrunch in an email.

title: Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg tells lawmaker he's not selling WhatsApp or Instagram
text: Zuckerberg has been meeting with several US lawmakers this week.

title: One of Zuckerberg's top critics in Congress says he told him to sell Instagram and WhatsApp
text: Sen. Josh Hawley, R-Mo., said Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg "was not receptive" to his suggestion that he sell Instagram and WhatsApp.

title: Mark Zuckerberg doesn't answer questions between meetings with senators
text: CNBC's Ylan Mui asks Facebook CEO questions about his meetings with senators, data privacy and more as he walks between meetings.

title: Mark Zuckerberg meets with senators on Captiol Hill
text: CNBC's Ylan Mui reports on Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg's arrival on Capitol Hill to meet with senators.

title: Zuckerberg goes to Capitol Hill to address internet regulation
text: Sen. Mark Warner (D-VA) reflects on his meeting with Facebook's Mark Zuckerberg and discusess rising tension with Iran since the attack on a Saudi oil refinery.

title: Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg heads to Capitol Hill
text: Yahoo Finance's Jessica Smith reports on the private meeting between lawmakers and Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg to discuss regulation.

title: The Wall Street Journal: Zuckerberg spars with senators at private Washington dinner
text: Facebook Inc. FB, +0.73%   CEO Mark Zuckerberg kicked off a lobbying trip to the capital by sparring with senators at a private dinner over a range of online woes including election security, privacy and competition.

title: The Margin: Here’s why kids won’t see ads for detox teas and lip injections on Instagram and Facebook anymore

title: Embattled Facebook CEO Zuckerberg seeks to mend fences in Washington
text: Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg is meeting with lawmakers on Capitol Hill for a second day on Thursday as part of an effort by the social media giant to mend its reputation as it faces a slew of government investigations.

title: Facebook CEO Zuckerberg, under fire, seeks to mend fences in Washington
text: Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg is meeting with lawmakers on Capitol Hill for a second day on Thursday as part of an effort by the social media giant to mend its reputation as it faces a slew of government investigations.

title: Comcast, Facebook Join the Streaming War, Roku Shares Fall
text: Video-streaming space gets increasingly crowded as Comcast and Facebook join the bandwagon. However, intensifying price war and fight for exclusive rights are threats.

title: Facebook expands its playable and AR ad formats
text: Ahead of Advertising Week, Facebook is the announcing the expansion of three interactive ad formats. First, it says that poll ads (which you may already have seen in Instagram Stories) are moving to the main feed of the Facebook mobile app.

title: Facebook will be sticking ads with polls, games and AR into News Feed
text: The interactive advertising formats were already being tested in Instagram and other parts of the Facebook universe. Now they'll be in your feed.

title: Facebook's new interactive ads let you play a game or try on lipstick colors
text: The formats will be available for Facebook's News Feed.

title: Mark Zuckerberg Makes the Rounds On Capitol Hill Amid Calls For Regulation
text: Capitol Hill will be abuzz today with sightings of Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg, who is meeting with a series of lawmakers amid the greater likelihood of regulation and antitrust scrutiny of the social media giant. title: Facebook Luxottica Deal to Bring AR Glasses Mainstream

title: Facebook admits new smart devices allow people to listen in
text: Facebook had admitted people will be allowed to listen in to audio captured by its new smart devices, despite stopping the controversial practice in its Messenger app.

title: Here's why regulators are so worried about Facebook's digital currency
